meanings.definition: A person or thing that activates or causes something to start or function.
meanings.sent1: The activators in the lab helped start the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The activators in the remote control turned on the TV.
meanings.sent3: The activators in the alarm clock made waking up a bit more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement acted as an activator, sparking motivation in the team.
meanings.sent5: The key was the activator that unlocked the mystery.

meanings.definition: Chemical substances that initiate a specific process or reaction.
meanings.sent1: Scientists added the activators to the mixture to start the reaction.
meanings.sent2: The activators in the solution caused a rapid color change.
meanings.sent3: The activators in the potion made the cauldron bubble unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The catalyst acted as an activator, speeding up the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent5: The activators were like magic ingredients, transforming the liquid into solid gold.

meanings.definition: An electronic device that turns on or controls a system or function.
meanings.sent1: The activators on the panel switched on the lights in the room.
meanings.sent2: The activators in the smart home system controlled the thermostat.
meanings.sent3: The activators in the remote made changing channels effortless.
meanings.sent4: The button served as an activator, starting the music player.
meanings.sent5: The activators were like tiny wizards, casting spells to activate devices.
